CHAPTER  6-6
BICYCLES
6-6-1
LIGHTS
Every bicycle upon any street during the period from a half (½) hour after sunset to a
half (½) hour before sunrise and at any other time when there is not sufficient light to
render clearly discernible any person on the street at a distance of two hundred (200)
feet ahead, shall be equipped with a lighted front lamp exhibiting a white light visible
from a distance of at least three hundred (300) feet to the front and with a rear red lamp
or reflector so designed and maintained as to be visible from a distance of two hundred
(200) feet from such bicycle.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-2
BRAKES
Every bicycle when operated upon a highway shall be equipped with a brake adequate to
control the movement and to stop such bicycle whenever necessary.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-3
TRAFFIC REGULATIONS GENERALLY
Every person riding a bicycle upon a roadway shall be subject to the provisions of this
code applicable to the driver of a vehicle except as to special regulations of this article
and except as to those provisions of this code which by their nature can have no
application.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-4
MANNER OF RIDING
No person shall ride or propel a bicycle upon any street except in a careful or prudent
manner and unless such person shall be capable of efficient control and operation of
such bicycle.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-5
PASSENGERS PROHIBITED
No person shall propel or operate any bicycle upon a street carrying or permitting to be

carried any other person upon such bicycle excepting infant type carriers or seats. 
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-6
CLINGING TO VEHICLES
Any person riding upon any bicycle shall not attach the same or himself to any vehicle
upon a street.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-7
RIDING ABREAST
Persons riding bicycles upon a street shall not ride abreast at any time except while in
the process of passing. 
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-8
CARRYING ARTICLES
No person riding a bicycle shall carry any packages, bundle, or article which prevents
the rider from keeping both hands upon the handlebars.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-9
ACROBATIC RIDING
No rider of a bicycle shall remove both hands from the handlebar or feet from the pedals
or practice any acrobatic or fancy riding on any street.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-10
SPEED, CONTESTS
No person shall, while operating a bicycle upon a street, participate in any race for speed
or endurance contest with any other vehicle, except under permit from an under the
supervision of the police department.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 

6-6-11
INTERFERING WITH PEDESTRIANS
No person shall ride or propel any bicycle upon any street in such a manner as to
interfere with any pedestrian thereon.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974. 
6-6-12
REGISTRATION AND LICENSE REQUIREMENTS
Bicycles shall be registered at City Hall and licensed by the City.  The fee for licensing
shall be determined by resolution of the City Council.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
Ordinance No. 10 1974.
